title: GeoDa Lab SDOH Data
description: The data explores four dimensions (Socioeconomic Advantage, Limited Mobility, Urban Core Opportunity, Mixed Immigrant Cohesion& Accessibility) of the social determinants of health of all census tracts at the neighborhood level across the continental United States. The data contain variables derived from the 2014 American Community Survey 5-year mean. It has 71,901 observations and 25 variables.  It looked at all the populated census tracts on the United States mainland to look for patterns across SDOH indicators.
creator: The University of Chicago Center for Spatial Data Science
The AHA Center for Health Innovation
publisher: The University of Chicago Center for Spatial Data Science
provider: Healthy Regions & Policies Lab, University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign
methods_variables: Percentage of persons below poverty estimate, 2010-2014 ACS
Percentage of civilian (age 16+) unemployed estimate, 2010-2014 ACS
Percentage of persons with no high school diploma (age 25+) estimate, 2010-2014 ACS
Percentage of single parent households with children under 18 estimate, 2010-2014 ACS
Percentage of persons (age 5+) who speak English “less than well” estimate, 2010-2014 ACS
Percentage of households with more people than rooms estimate, 2010-2014 ACS
Percentage of households with no vehicle available estimate, 2010-2014 ACS
Percentage of renters paying over 30% of income towards housing estimate, 2010-2014 ACS
Percentage of uninsured in the total civilian noninstitutionalized population estimate, 2010- 2014 ACS
Percentage minority (all persons except white, non-Hispanic) estimate, 2010-2014 ACS
Percentage of persons aged 65 and older estimate, 2010-2014 ACS
Percentage of persons aged 17 and younger estimate, 2010-2014 ACS
Percentage of civilian noninstitutionalized population with a disability estimate, 2010-2014 ACS
